etymology.description: 学(學) (xué, "learn") + 校(校) (xiào, "school") = a place where learning occurs -> school
etymology.interpretation: In this word, 学(學) (xué, "learn") emphasizes the process of gaining knowledge or skills, while 校(校) (xiào, "school") denotes a place or institution where this learning takes place. Together, these characters convey the concept of a school as an organized setting for education.

examples.chinese: 我在学校工作(我在學校工作)。
孩子们在学校学习(孩子們在學校學習)。
从早到晚(從早到晚)，学校充满活力(學校充滿活力)。
examples.pinyin: Cóng zǎo dào wǎn, xuéxiào chōngmǎn huólì.
examples.english: From morning to evening, the school is full of energy.
